And if you use a condom the risk drops by 30%, correct?So why is it that all the website and info I've been reading is saying that you can still transmit the virus without symptoms? I mean yes, there is still a chance, but it seems to be a very small chance based on the statistics. Why don't most sources acknowledge this?The fact that I got it also makes me wonder if those statistics about the low transmission rate are accurate because I had sex with the guy that gave it to me once, with a condom and i don't think he was having an outbreak (he claims he didn't know he had it). Am I just really unlucky? I also have diabetes and was getting a cold when we had sex, so maybe my immune system couldn't fight it off?
